text:
OS Platform: FreeBSD 6.0-RELEASE
Ports:       www/apache22 (version 2.2.0)
Build options:   MPM (worker), all modules are built STATICALLY.

Symptom:     I.E. 6.0+ was able to display HTML page correctly.
             But, mozilla/netscape/firefox will display the SOURCE of the HTML
page. ALL strictky html source text, no image is displayable as well.

             I haven't debugged the HEADERs sent by the httpd, but this breaks
pretty loudly and I don't believe it's the FreeBSD apache22 ports that break
anything.
creator: sunyuxi@yahoo.com

text:
Hmmm... I'm not sure why you are posting a bug report if you haven't looked at
the http response headers.  That is the only place that apache would influence
the display of the final content.

This sounds more like a question for the users list, but if you really think it
is a bug, we'll need to see the headers and any relevant changes you made to the
default config.
creator: slive@apache.org
dimm@email.cz
text:
no errors in the error log. all looks fine. server listening on a given port. 
When Test configuration is ran it says 'syntax OK'. no firewalls nor any other 
interfering soft installed...

Yet the thtml page does NOT display like there were no connection...

New comment is unrelated to the old bug report, and both belong on a
user-support forum, not the bug database.
creator: slive@apache.org
